article.title: Utilizing the KSC Fixation Tube to Conduct Human-Tended Plant Biology Experiments on a Suborbital Spaceflight

funding.text: NASA Flight Opportunities and Biological and Physical Sciences grant 80NSSC18K1294
funding.normalized: nasa flight opportunities and biological and physical sciences grant 80nssc18k1294

article.abstract: Suborbital spaceflights now enable human-tended research investigating short-term gravitational effects in biological systems, eliminating the need for complex automation.

sections.introduction: The commercial suborbital spaceflight industry enables customers to reach the cusp of space and experience microgravity for several minutes before returning to Earth.
sections.methods: Wet-sterilized Columbia-0 (Col-0) seeds were planted aseptically on the surface of 10 cm2 solid media plates comprised of the coupon inlaid with 1% Phytagel/0.5Ã— MS media.
sections.results: The original purpose of the KFT was to allow astronauts in space to apply fixative or other chemical compounds that are often toxic to biological samples without the use of a microgravity glovebox while maintaining three levels of containment.
sections.discussion: The data presented herein suggest that KFTs can be readily adapted for carrying biological samples to space in a safely contained fashion.

technologies: nebnext ultra ii directional rna library prep kit
spt labtech mosquito lv liquid handling instrument

technologies_detail.text: nebnext ultra ii directional rna library prep kit
technologies_detail.normalized: nebnext ultra ii directional rna library prep kit

article.insights_summary: Suborbital spaceflights now enable human-tended research investigating short-term gravitational effects in biological systems, eliminating the need for complex automation. The data presented herein suggest that KFTs can be readily adapted for carrying biological samples to space in a safely contained fashion.
article.acknowledgments: We thank members of UF Interdisciplinary Center for Biotechnology Research (ICBR) in Bioinformatics (RRID:SCR_019120), Gene Expression and Genotyping (RRID:SCR_019145) and NextGen DNA sequencing (RRID:SCR_019152) cores, for their support and services.
